title: Is this the most secure iPhone 15 case on the market?
content:
Macworld

The importance of a great iPhone case

In September, Apple announced four brand-new smartphones: the iPhone 15, 15 Plus, 15 Pro, and 15 Pro Max. These are the company’s most advanced handsets ever, featuring the latest processors, upgraded cameras, and new titanium and aluminum designs. But if you’re lucky enough to own one of these luxurious new devices, it’s crucial that you find the right case to protect it.

Why? Because, for all the physical advances made in each iPhone generation, from the Ceramic Shield on their screens to their titanium bodies, current smartphone design simply cannot stand up to one moment of carelessness or bad luck. The phone slips from your hand, it lands at an awkward angle, and your $1,000+ device is permanently marred by a cracked screen or a badly chipped chassis.

Rather than depending on your phone being tough, then, it makes far more sense to choose a case that will protect it from drop and scratch damage. And it would be even better if the case could incorporate a clever feature that makes it less likely to get dropped (or lost) in the first place. That’s where Speck comes in.

Why Speck makes the right iPhone 15 case for you

The new iPhones all support Apple’s popular MagSafe standard, a neat feature which ensures they attach themselves magnetically to compatible charging pads and other accessories. But Speck has come up with a way to make MagSafe even more secure. It’s called ClickLock™.

The one potential problem with MagSafe is slipping. While the magnetic connection resists powerfully when you pull the iPhone directly away from the charging pad, it’s far easier to break the connection by moving it laterally; you can easily–or accidentally–slide the iPhone sideways until it slips right off the pad and breaks the connection. ClickLock removes this issue by introducing a moving ‘bolt’ that clicks into place when the magnet is engaged. The bolt, on the accessory side, is pulled forward into a niche on the iPhone case side, ensuring an even stronger fit with no possibility of lateral slipping.

Note that ClickLock isn’t something that’s offered by even the latest iPhones out of the box; this is exclusive to cases made by Speck. However, ClickLock cases can still be used with standard MagSafe accessories, albeit without the additional benefits of the mechanical locking feature.

Of course, while ClickLock is an innovative way to enhance MagSafe, Speck doesn’t stop there. Its iPhone cases are made to the highest standards of design and functionality. And of the 169 new cases the company has announced for the iPhone 15 range, 57 feature ClickLock, which means there’s sure to be a look, and a degree of protection, to suit your tastes. Whether you want the subtle elegance of the Presidio Perfect-Clear cases (from $39.95), or the 13-foot drop-tested protection, raised-bezel screen and camera guards, anti-scratch coating, and Microban antimicrobial product protection of the ultra-tough Presidio2 (also from $39.95), there’s an iPhone 15 case here for you.

An entire ecosystem of ClickLock accessories

But wait! There’s more.

Speck has an entire ecosystem of ClickLock-compatible accessories. If you’re interested in a ClickLock case for your iPhone 15, it’s worth checking out the rest of the range.

Speck’s Car Vent Mount for MagSafe with ClickLock ($39.99), for example, creates a super-secure in-car attachment. Wallet for MagSafe ($29.99) holds up to three credit or ID cards, and won’t fall off when you take your iPhone 15 out of your pocket. And the incredibly versatile StandyGrip for MagSafe ($29.99) combines the security of ClickLock with a convenient portrait/landscape kickstand, an adjustable finger grip, and a MacBook mount for Continuity Camera.
